thread.title_full: Mayor Tory responds to Kansas City mayor's ALCS bet | Toronto & GTA | News | Tor

author: torontosun.com
title: Mayor Tory responds to Kansas City mayor's ALCS bet | Toronto & GTA | News | Tor
text:
TORONTO - The trash-talking between the mayors of Toronto and Kansas City is flowing like maple syrup in springtime.
As the Toronto Blue Jays and the Kansas City Royals start the American League Championship Series on Friday night, Toronto Mayor John Tory and Kansas City Mayor Sly James were working out a wager through the media.
James put some of Kansas City's ribs and barbecue sauces on the line Thursday.
If the Jays beat the Royals, James will send the meal north of the border to Tory's office.
"I wouldn't start getting your knives and forks out, however, because we plan to win this thing," James said.
He went on to encourage Tory to bet "something good, brother" and warned him, "we have our own maple syrup, so something else maybe."
Tory - who is holding a special press conference in Nathan Phillips Square over the lunch hour to announce what he'll be betting on the hometown baseball team - said early Friday that he'll be sending maple syrup to his Kansas City counterpart no matter what.
"The mayor said they have their own maple syrup, I wasn't aware of the burgeoning Kansas maple syrup industry but I think that even if they have a very excellent maple syrup - with what I am sure is a quality product - it's not the real thing," Tory said in response to James. "Regardless of the outcome of this series, I will be sending him some maple syrup that is real maple syrup, real Canadian maple syrup on the basis that he should not be denied the opportunity to sample that - especially if it is being used to drown his sorrows."
